data.title: Lectures at St. Ignatius: John F. Kennedy, The Houston Speech, and Catholic Citizenship
data.meta_description: PRESENTER: Mark Massa, S.J., Director of the Boisi Center for Religion and American Public Life and Professor of Theology at Boston College John F. Kennedy’s ‘Houston Speech’ before 300 Protestant […]
data.meta_site_name: Church of St. Ignatius Loyola, NYC
data.text:
PRESENTER: Mark Massa, S.J., Director of the Boisi Center for Religion and American Public Life and Professor of Theology at Boston College

John F. Kennedy’s ‘Houston Speech’ before 300 Protestant clergymen in 1960 supposedly won him the presidency. Was that good news for the Catholic presidential candidates who came after him?

About the Presenter
